Context:
This table is about the section 2.3 Stream Execution > Folder Execute. 
Title: (4) Follow the following steps to set the options for the Folder Execute. 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = Steps; row 1, column 2 = Setting name; row 1, column 3 = Setting name; row 1, column 4 = Description; row 2, column 1 = (1); row 2, column 2 = Input Folder; row 2, column 3 = Input Folder; row 2, column 4 = Type in the folder directory or click the right search button to find.; row 3, column 1 = (2); row 3, column 2 = Filter Option; row 3, column 3 = File Extension; row 3, column 4 = Type in the file extension of the files within the executing folder.; row 4, column 1 = (3); row 4, column 2 = ; row 4, column 3 = File Name; row 4, column 4 = Type in the common file name within the executing folder.; row 5, column 1 = (4); row 5, column 2 = Input/Output Settings; row 5, column 3 = Input/Output Settings; row 5, column 4 = Set the Input and Output node within the executing project file by clicking the Input Node Setting and Output Node Setting. Click the Output Node Delete to delete the inserted output node settings.
table_html:
Steps Setting name Description
(1) Input Folder Type in the folder directory or click the right search button to find.
(2) Filter Option File Extension Type in the file extension of the files within the executing folder.
(3) File Name Type in the common file name within the executing folder.
(4) Input/Output Settings Set the Input and Output node within the executing project file by clicking the Input Node Setting and Output Node Setting. Click the Output Node Delete to delete the inserted output node settings.
(5) Folder Execution Option Log file of the folder execution process can be saved by setting the Folder Execution Options. (Not required)

Context:
This table is about the section 2.3 Stream Execution > Folder Execute. 
Title: (4) Follow the following steps to set the options for the Folder Execute. 
Header candidates: row 1, column 1 = Steps; row 1, column 2 = Setting name; row 1, column 3 = Setting name; row 1, column 4 = Description 
Rows: row 6, column 1 = (5); row 6, column 2 = Folder Execution Option; row 6, column 3 = Folder Execution Option; row 6, column 4 = Log file of the folder execution process can be saved by setting the Folder Execution Options. (Not required)
table_html:
Steps Setting name Description
(1) Input Folder Type in the folder directory or click the right search button to find.
(2) Filter Option File Extension Type in the file extension of the files within the executing folder.
(3) File Name Type in the common file name within the executing folder.
(4) Input/Output Settings Set the Input and Output node within the executing project file by clicking the Input Node Setting and Output Node Setting. Click the Output Node Delete to delete the inserted output node settings.
(5) Folder Execution Option Log file of the folder execution process can be saved by setting the Folder Execution Options. (Not required)

Context:
This table is about the section 2.3 Stream Execution > Folder Execute. 
Title: [image:rId56] 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = File; row 1, column 2 = The default log file storage path is the ECMiner™ installation location.; row 2, column 1 = Rotation; row 2, column 2 = Logs can be rotated daily, weekly, or monthly, with the default set to never.; row 3, column 1 = Archive; row 3, column 2 = Log file names can be based on numbers or timestamps, with timestamps as the default.; row 4, column 1 = Level; row 4, column 2 = Only logs at or above the specified level are recorded, with trace capturing the most details.; row 5, column 1 = Times; row 5, column 2 = The reference time for log rotation defaults to local time.
table_html:
File The default log file storage path is the ECMiner™ installation location.
Rotation Logs can be rotated daily, weekly, or monthly, with the default set to never.
Archive Log file names can be based on numbers or timestamps, with timestamps as the default.
Level Only logs at or above the specified level are recorded, with trace capturing the most details.
Times The reference time for log rotation defaults to local time.
Format Logs are stored in the format "[%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S.%i][%q][%s] %t" by default. * %s : Log record source %t: Log record

table_html:
File The default log file storage path is the ECMiner™ installation location.
Rotation Logs can be rotated daily, weekly, or monthly, with the default set to never.
Archive Log file names can be based on numbers or timestamps, with timestamps as the default.
Level Only logs at or above the specified level are recorded, with trace capturing the most details.
Times The reference time for log rotation defaults to local time.
Format Logs are stored in the format "[%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S.%i][%q][%s] %t" by default. * %s : Log record source %t: Log record
